page.title: 19CATTLE AND MILK,PEMBROKE.
page.content: There are several breeds of{dairy {cattle}in Britain.The most important are the{British Friesian,}the{ {Ayrshire,}the{Dairy Shorthorn,}the{ {Jersey}and the{Guernsey.}The last two are called the Channel Island breeds and give milk with higher fat content and better cream than the other breeds. Farmers try to improve their cattle to increase the output of milk.A cow is first milked after it has had its first calf.The amount of milk produced from that time until a few weeks before the next calf is born is weighed and added up,this is known as milk recording.The period when a cow can be milked is called the{lactation} period.
